comment: Pretty good Washington Bourbon, sweet not too unique
Aroma, young (heat) with tropical citrus & caramel. Mild attenuation (sugary) with cooking spice & earth tones. Medium - Strong heat.
Pale gold in color with fruity and Carmel citrus aromas.
Woody. Oaky. Caramel. Sweet. Long slow burn. Not bad.
this is my favorite bourbon bar none - the slightly higher than average rye content really comes through and leaves a delightful (and unique) finish. Never tasted a bourbon quite like it.
Leathery and soft on the taste. Light cherry on the nose. 3.5.
I'm really at odds with this bourbon. What I can say is this, I've had sub $20 bourbons that taste way better.
Tasted great on the tongue but the finish was very sharp

Nose - Spicy herbal vanilla, rickhouse-like young oak barrel smell, light cinnamon caramels.
Taste - Spicy cinnamon burn, funky sweet vanilla like a sugar-free oaky, mint, pepper caramel, hint of sweet rye bread and maple syrup.
Finish - Lingering spice, sweet herbal funk lingers, dry splenda-like oak sweetness, rye bread and maple syrup.
Score - 70/100
Final Thoughts - So I'm not sure if my batch is older than their website description, but I did not get the cherries they mention. I get the impression that this is a fairly young bourbon and get quite a bit of young oak and young spirit bite from this. It tasted like a blend of young & slightly older as I got the young bit, but also a silky, mellow, maple syrup-like mouthfeel. Not too bad neat, but I think this would be best in a cocktail to help mellow out the young spirit harshness.

Sweet malty aroma
Sweet vanilla flavor. Bright oak, brighter than usual but it's a good flavor. Pop of flavor, super forward.
Spicy. But of citrus. Brown sugar. Mint on the end.
Some difficult notes on the finish take away from a reasonable nose and good initial flavor.
Thin mouthfeel,followed by a short finish. I wish there was more going on here but it’s a fleeting experience over all. Glad this was a gift.
smokey, with a piney kind of bite.
Gets good with a bit of water
sweet and floral nose, smooth sip with soft peat, small spicy burn  on the follow.

Nose: I mostly got oak and a little vanilla, maybe a bit of floral smell but not much. Ethanol smell was there too
Palate: kind of thin, mostly was tasting a spicy vanilla/caramel kind of flavor?
Finish: pretty harsh alcohol on the finish, personally not noticing much else

This glass is about halfway down the bottle, it’s gotten a bit of air into it by now. Not terrible but not very complex, also really not a fan of the harsh aftertaste. I’ve had barrel proofs with less alcohol harshness on the finish. I enjoy mixing this but as a neat bourbon not my favorite. Picked this up on a whim but will probably pass next time, especially for the price.
Very methanol, young, bright popery... not... the... greatest... disappointment. Kinda hurts.
not as sweet as my normal but good
Bananas and baking spice; dry finish. Absolutely wonderful!
this was crazy. and i am just testing this app.
I'm enjoying my bottle now that its 1/3 down and has had time to open up.
Upon further inspection,and more time to breathe,the whiskey exhibits a vanilla sweetness with a light brown sugar finish.
